page.title: 02Landscape,Farming and Soils
page.content: The Weald Moors were mosslands based on glacial drift.The name Weald Moor derives from wild or wooded moors as these lowlands were formerly overgrown with deciduous vegetation such as Alders and Willows. Coniferous plantation and windbreak stands are often found on higher,exposed ground in the area. 3 soil samples were taken from contrasting points,grid references as follows 642179,61,666171,66,677161,54 They were analysed as follows:-sample 1 A fine silt clay containing little humus,sample 2 A sandy silt loam with a high clay content,containing more coarse particles and humus than sample 1.The higher concentration of large particles and humus improve soil texture,sample 3 Almost entirely humus with no appreciable mineral content,typical of bog land.
